snippet: A British court has ruled for the first time that a man who lacks the capacity to give informed consent should have a vasectomy because it is in his best interests.
abstract: British court rules for the first time that a learning disabled man who lacks the capacity to give informed consent should have a vasectomy because it is in his best interests.
lead_paragraph: A British court has ruled for the first time that a man who lacks the capacity to give informed consent should have a vasectomy because it is in his best interests.

headline.main: Britain: Court Approves Vasectomy for Disabled Man
